topic.title: When I move systems ZeroMe keep asks me to recreate my profile.
topic.body: Do profiles not migrate between zeronet instances? I mean, I have zeronet on a online machine (with my ZeroID and ZeroMe account) than I launch another Zeronet instance on another online machine using the same masterseed. Now ZeroMe treats me as if I don't have an account...

1_1KWkL7gwdvnn1moF2cB9ZfdYCEtEWcPkWy.body: [aitorpazos], thank you! i got my username back! :)

1_1CjmMpMZgtzY2w9REEwLWQbtHhd5B5NStZ.body: I tried IPFS yesterday to upload and host a website. It works quite strikingly similar to Zeronet. With the IPFS advantage of allowing "normal" domains. On the other hand Zeronet auto-seeding feature is an advantage to its hosted websites but other than that I'm having a hard time seeing the differences.

1_1DFDjUGJdSp1kMuFq1AtNS9ZWmkVtbp947.body:
> [wieke](#comment_1_13Zs1NLz7LS9NsWtaQLwBmUZEXfz1i3agg): I'm pretty sure your ids are stored in users.json in the data folder. Not online. Take that one with you to the other machine. (Or run zeronet on a private proxy.)

That's what I did... the login interface can detect my correct ZeroID name but then ZeroMe asks me to create an account. I had an account before...
Thanks everyone, It was indeed a syncing problem: today I see myself automatically logged in.
